sub_title: Helping greenkeepers and groundsmen optimize healthy sports turf playing surface | Biologically increasing healthy crop yields for farmers | High-performance biostimulants for soil and plant improvement
summary:
GREENKEEPER AND GROUNDSMAN:
As a greenkeeper and groundsman, you know how challenging it can be to keep sports turf in optimal condition. And more and more people want to avoid the toxic chemicals found in most products - We have the perfect solution for you!

Healthy sports turf provides athletes the best playing surface and can withstand disease and heavy usage. That’s exactly what our biologically-based products help turf managers achieve. 

FARMER AND AGRICULTURE DISTRIBUTOR:
If you are in agriculture you want to increase the quality and yield of your crops - We have the answer for you and it’s biological!

We’ve developed innovative, environmentally friendly solutions for soil and plant improvement that are unique in the industry. 

The result: 
- Higher quality, more nutritious, and healthier produce without sacrificing yield or compromising on environmental sustainability.
- Improved health and productivity of your crops 
- Reduced input costs and disease pressure

I’m passionate about helping you achieve your goals with sustainable, biological solutions. 

Let’s talk!

Message me or email me at Luke@Abundigro.com

awards.title: Visionary Innovation Award Water Treatment South Africa, 2013
awards.description:
Frost & Sullivan’s Global Research Platform

Frost & Sullivan is in its 50th year in business with a global research organization of 1,800 analysts and consultants who monitor more than 300 industries and 250,000 companies. The company’s research philosophy originates with the CEO’s 360-Degree Perspective™, which serves as the foundation of its TEAM Research™ methodology. This unique approach enables us to determine how best-in-class companies worldwide manage growth, innovation and leadership. Based on the findings of this Best Practices research, Frost & Sullivan is proud to present the 2013 South African Visionary Innovation Award in Water Treatment to Sustainable Engineering Solutions (SES) and Organic Water Solutions (OWS).

projects.title: Noble Resources - Standerton Soya Mill Waste Water Treatment Plant
projects.description:
MBR plant for Noble Resources
The construction of a R600 million state-of-the-art soya crushing plant in Standerton, Mpumalanga has recently been completed.  The Singaporean based company Noble Resources (76th largest company in the world according to Fortune 500) appointed Sustainable Engineering to deliver a 300kℓ/day Membrane Waste Water Treatment Plant to treat the soya plant's effluent water. 

The soya oil factory will produce 2 000 tons of oil per day and discharge as much as 270kℓ of industrial effluent per day plus some domestic effluent from the office complex.

Sustainable Engineering designed the plant to include cutting edge technology such as Kubota's MBR units. The system consists of Anaerobic / Aerobic / Anoxic / MBR and disinfection steps. 
 
Kubota have trained the Sustainable Engineering Consulting team to design, implement, construct and maintain the MBR units in accordance with their international standards. 

The treated effluent discharge quality will exceed General Standards to be recycled for process and wash water.

projects.title: Beyerskloof Cellar - Waste Water Treatment Plant
projects.description:
Beyer Truter’s original search for land was focused on one thing only: finding the best soils to produce a Cabernet Sauvignon-based wine. 

Beyerskloof is one of the many farms in and around Stellenbosch asking OWS to build them Waste Water Treatment Plants to make sure all effluent from the cellar is fit to be released into the environment and precious soil on the farm that allowed Beyer Truter to become the International Winemaker of the Year at the 1991 International Wine and Spirit Competition .

projects.title: Kanu Waste Water Treatment Plant
projects.description: This Wine cellar presses 500 tons of effluent and is designed to handle domestic waste as well as the restaurant waste. The WWTP can treat up to 20 000 liters per day and discharges treated effluent at General Standards which then can be recycled for irrigation or cleaning purposes or even released into a river system.

profile_positions.title: Founder

profile_positions.description:
I have worked for this company for four years, in this time I successfully established a Global Channel Partnership program with elite partners around the world. Year on year the company experienced 25% growth more than doubling its turn over in four years.

Daily responsibilities include:

- Business development strategy, awareness of the market and account requirements
- Create opportunities and manage co-marketing & programs to drive joint success with channels
- Relationship management, 'trusted adviser' to channel partners 
- Lead cross-team collaboration to influence execution
- Develop and actively review sales strategies with partners and agree on associated action plans
- Mining for future opportunities, assess risks, dissect and learn from key wins/losses
- Business planning cycles and quarterly business reviews 
- Anticipate competition, develop competitive active plan, strategic thinking
- Software licensing
- Enterprise licensing and enterprise growth strategy
- Accountable for; forecast accuracy, revenue attainment, customer and partner experience.
- Contract generation and maintenance
- Pipeline management
- Marketing strategy and product marketing
- CRM administrator (Sales-force)
- Sales presentations
- Manage Global Conferences, Workshops and Sales Events
                    - North America, South America, Europe, Russia, India, Eastern Asia
- Stong relationship with ANSYS and associated channel partners
- Engineering Software (CFD / FEA / CAE / Systems 1D-2D) sales and marketing management
profile_positions.title: International Channel and Marketing Manager for Flownex Simulation Environment

profile_positions.description:
Business development and marketing manager for turnkey Waste Water and Water Treatment services from Design to implementation throughout Africa. I doubled their turnover in one year.

Specialists in sustainable water solutions: Producing superior designed Waste Water Treatment Plants (with optional biogas facilities) and Water Treatment Plants for residential, commercial and hotel development and industrial, commercial and agricultural process factories where water management is of paramount concern.

My Responsibilities:

New Product Development
New Product Management
Building loyal trustworthy and profitable business relationships
Penetrate and Hold new Markets
Gathering and leveraging sales intelligence
Managing and motivating sales teams
Managing KPI’s
Mastering customers business in order to pre-empt their needs
Maximize ROI
Manage Risk prudently
profile_positions.title: International Business Development Manager

profile_positions.description:
Organic Water Solutions provides solutions for the water industry, focusing on polluted water bodies and effluent treatment. Our Engineering division supplies Waste Water Treatment Plants to industries of all natures with a revolutionary and cost-effective containerized or masonry plant as well as suppliers of micro-digestive organisms for grey and black water treatment.

I was responsible for the Business development of the company along with all strategic moves regarding sales and marketing. I was involved from the start and grew the company to over 6 digits turn over in my time here.
profile_positions.title: Sales and Marketing Manager

profile_positions.description: This was my baby, the first business I ever started. From branding to marketing to performing initial sales to eventually managing and directing an export company for the pet shop aquarium world. Thus began my involvement in the water ecology world and my success as a business development manager and channel management.
